image.altText: Two people wearing possum skins pass a traditional object between each other.

props.synopsis: Victoria's historic treaty is promising to "reckon with the past" and empower the state's First Peoples — and explicitly declares it will not take anything away from the broader community.

title.children: Victoria to become first state to introduce treaty to parliament

image.altText: A road winds through rolling hills in the countryside.

props.synopsis: With Erin Patterson's 33-year sentence handed down, the Gippsland community hopes to get back to normal.

title.children: Gippslanders ready to move on after Erin Patterson trial

image.altText: A police coffin at a funeral with cap and flowers on top of it

props.synopsis: Lisa Thompson says her final weekend with her boyfriend Neal Thompson before he was killed in a shooting at Porepunkah was their best yet.

title.children: Police officer Neal Thompson farewelled by grieving loved ones

image.altText: Erin Patterson being led into a prison van

props.synopsis: Over the course of 46 minutes, Justice Christopher Beale outlined the case that has gripped Australia — and the world — for more than two years.

title.children: 'Failure to exhibit any remorse': What the judge revealed in Erin Patterson sentencing

image.altText: Nurses and supporting trade unionists rally outside Parliament House in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: For the first time in 36 years Victorian nurses' union members will vote on a new branch secretary after a failed pay deal led to the resignation of the former boss.

title.children: Turmoil in powerful nurses union as members vote on Victorian branch boss

image.altText: A young woman with long dark hair smiles big looking up. Behind is a collage of images including her as a child and a pink robe

props.synopsis: When Louisa Ioannidis was found dead in a creek, police found no suspicious circumstances. But Louisa’s brother had his doubts, and now a legal team has found compelling new evidence that the case should be reopened.

title.children: 'Hallmarks of something suspicious': How could a 24yo drown in knee-high water?

image.altText: A young man wearing a puffer jacket smiles while holding a red shoe.

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old boy killed as he made his way home from playing basketball is being mourned as police investigate the fatal stabbing of two children in Melbourne's outer-west on Saturday night.

title.children: 'Beautiful' young man among pair mourned after fatal Melbourne attacks

image.altText: Anti-immigration rally Canberra

props.synopsis: Australia's Neo-Nazis sought to make their own message out of anti-immigration marches, and they succeeded.

title.children: Australia's Neo-Nazis have had an unadulterated propaganda win

image.altText: Sheep having a feed. Drone photo taken from above.

props.synopsis: The nation's drought supports will come under scrutiny at a major national forum today as southern farmers continue to battle dry times.

title.children: Farmers call for low-interest loans as cash flow dries up in drought

image.altText: GettyImages-2233113636

props.synopsis: Dockers coach Justin Longmuir says the AFL should issue fines of up to $10,000 to players for staging.

title.children: Coach calls for huge fines to stamp out AFL players staging for free kicks

image.altText: GettyImages-2234088784

props.synopsis: Chloe Molloy kicks a stunner and Zippy Fish stars as the Swans account for the Dockers in the AFLW.

title.children: Molloy wonder goal stuns the crowd as Fish stars for Swans

image.altText: A red and black graphic of a crowd in silhouette under a white supremacist flag and the Australian flag.

props.synopsis: As the National Socialist Network follows the script of a far-right playbook in an attempt to position itself as a political movement, there are moves to have it proscribed as a terrorist group.

title.children: Leaked messages reveal how Neo-Nazis piggyback on groups abroad

image.altText: A woman standing in a warehouse with hi-vi jacket

props.synopsis: Cosmetics entrepreneurs through to tech developers say Austrade's signature export grant has become unfair, badly managed and opaque, all while many are struggling to adjust to Donald Trump's US tariffs.

title.children: Austrade outrage as exporters detail 'disaster' grants process

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: A 26-year-old Seabrook man dies in hospital following a shooting in Melbourne's CBD that police say appears targeted.

title.children: Police investigate fatal shooting in Melbourne's CBD

image.altText: Dau Akueng

props.synopsis: Two boys, aged 12 and 15, died on the streets of Melbourne's outer-west overnight after being stabbed in attacks police say had "the hallmarks of youth gang crime".

title.children: Community reacts to stabbing deaths of two children in Melbourne suburb

image.altText: Parentline logo

props.synopsis: After 25 years in operation, Victoria's Parentline service will shut on October 31 as the government withdraws funding.

title.children: Victoria to become only state without dedicated helpline for parents

image.altText: A custom pink Victorian licence plate saying Anni 25 on a pink car.

props.synopsis: Custom numberplates can be funny, sentimental and wildly abstract. They now make up one in every four numberplates in Victoria.

title.children: How custom numberplates reveal what's close to our hearts

image.altText: A woman holds photos of kids looking sad at the camera.

props.synopsis: Susan Dahal is finally able to apply to reunite with her children, but the Refugee Council of Australia says the process is "cruel" and not designed for refugees.

title.children: Mother endures 'cruel' wait to reunite with children after 13 years

image.altText: Two protesters holding signs that read 'save our pool'.

props.synopsis: The Australian Medical Association has urged the state government to intervene in a Melbourne council's decision to close a swimming pool, warning of "serious and predictable" health consequences.

title.children: AMA calls on local council to reverse decision to close swimming pool

image.altText: A painting of a green valley with shrubs on the side and a mountain in the background, in an ornate gold frame.g

props.synopsis: Russian artist Nicholas Chevalier's now-famous painting of Mt Abrupt in western Victoria is being used by a revegetation group to reflect the landscape as the artist saw it in 1864.

title.children: Clues in 161-year-old painting help restore Grampians' native beauty

image.altText: a view of St Patrick's Catholic cathedral in East Melbourne

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation can reveal the Catholic Church tried to revive a highly controversial legal loophole that stopped it from being sued by victims of sexual abuse for millions of dollars in damages, after it was scrapped in 2018.

title.children: Catholic Church tried to revive outlawed legal loophole in abuse case

image.altText: Dezi Freeman pictured outside a court in Wangaratta.

props.synopsis: Authorities are offering the largest reward in Victoria's history for information leading to the arrest of Dezi Freeman, as the hunt for alleged killer enters its 12th day.

title.children: 'Not an act of desperation': $1 million offered for Dezi Freeman's arrest

image.altText: A small gaggle of three geese in front of a sign that reads Riddells Creek

props.synopsis: More than 1,300 new homes will be built at Riddells Creek, just under an hour north of Melbourne, but residents say the already congested train network and roads will not cope with more people.

title.children: Trains and roads a concern as town north of Melbourne set to expand

image.altText: Gold Coast Suns coach Damien Hardwick laughs as he stands in the rooms after a finals win.

props.synopsis: Having lost their past 10 games at the Gabba, the Gold Coast Suns are confident they can buck history in the QClash semifinal against Brisbane after downing Fremantle in Perth.

title.children: Time to knock big brother off Gabba perch, Hardwick says after Suns big finals win

image.altText: Two women standing beside a man in front of a tram talking to each other

props.synopsis: Melbourne's best tram drivers are getting ready for a trip to Vienna to compete in the inaugural World Tramdriver Championship.

title.children: Cheers and skittles for tram drivers on track for world championships

image.altText: A man looks on during an A-League Men's match

props.synopsis: Western United's players are officially free agents with the club to be placed on ice for the next 12 months as they attempt to stave off extinction.

title.children: Western United enter hibernation as wind-up drags on

image.altText: A machete

props.synopsis: Victoria's ban on machetes has begun, but a closer look at the law behind it reveals a broad definition for them.

title.children: Victoria's machete ban creates confusion over knife definition

image.altText: A woman with straight, black, long hair smiles. There are plants behind her.

props.synopsis: Ararat, like most regional towns, has an ageing population and a drift of young people to the cities. But a migrant resettlement program is reinvigorating the town.

title.children: Migrants and refugees thrive in jobs locals 'not comfortable doing'

image.altText: The silhouette of a person holding a football.

props.synopsis: As football teams across Victoria gear up for finals season, a different kind of preparation is underway in the state's domestic violence support services.

title.children: Domestic violence support services brace for football finals spike

image.altText: A family at the kitchen table crowd around a birthday cake for a one year old in a vintage film photo.

props.synopsis: Some memories fade away, while others stay with us for life. But why can we remember some things and not others? And can you "make" a memory? This is what the experts say.

title.children: Do core memories really exist? We asked the experts

image.altText: A man uses a small electrical device to zap a racehorse as it runs on a treadmill.

props.synopsis: The newly released footage from 2018 shows now-barred trainer Darren Weir applying the "jigger" to a horse on a treadmill.

title.children: Tribunal releases video of top trainer using shock device on horse

image.altText: A woman standing inside an unfinished house

props.synopsis: Prosecutions against home builders are rising sharply in Victoria, with the new regulator warning consumer protection measures will be "on steroids".

title.children: Scores of builders facing prosecution as new watchdog bares teeth

image.altText: A sad-looking Brisbane AFL player wearing a training jacket stands on the MCG after a finals loss.

props.synopsis: Brisbane's premiership defence is on shaky ground after losing star midfielder Lachie Neale to a likely season-ending injury in their qualifying final defeat.

title.children: Lions 'not expecting great news' on premiership star after finals loss

image.altText: A group of people standing for a photo

props.synopsis: The former Victorian premier has defended a decision to travel to China for a military commemorative event, saying a constructive relationship with Australia's largest trading partner was in the country's national interest.

title.children: Daniel Andrews addresses controversial Beijing group photo

image.altText: Cartons of eggs on a supermarket shelf.

props.synopsis: Coles says the cost of living and supply chain disruptions are behind its decision to continue selling caged eggs until 2030. A consumer expert says it is likely the supermarket's competitors will follow suit.

title.children: Coles abandons plan to stop selling caged eggs by end of year
